info.title: Azure Communication Service Call Automation APIs
info.description: Azure Communication Service Call Automation APIs

parameters.name: Repeatability-Request-ID
parameters.description: If specified, the client directs that the request is repeatable; that is, that the client can make the request multiple times with the same Repeatability-Request-Id and get back an appropriate response without the server executing the request multiple times. The value of the Repeatability-Request-Id is an opaque string representing a client-generated unique identifier for the request. It is a version 4 (random) UUID.

parameters.name: Repeatability-First-Sent
parameters.description: If Repeatability-Request-ID header is specified, then Repeatability-First-Sent header must also be specified. The value should be the date and time at which the request was first created, expressed using the IMF-fixdate form of HTTP-date. Example: Sun, 06 Nov 1994 08:49:37 GMT.

201.description: Returns details of the call properties once the CreateCall request is received by service. You will receive CallConnected event at your specified callback URI, once the call is connected.

post.description: Answer a call using the IncomingCallContext from Event Grid.

200.description: Returns details of the call properties once the AnswerCall request is received by service. You will receive CallConnected event at your specified callback URI, once the call is connected.

204.description: The service has redirected the call to specified endpoint.

204.description: The service has rejected the call.

get.summary: Get the detail properties of an ongoing call.

200.description: Returns details of the call properties.

delete.summary: Hang up call automation service from the call. This will make call automation service leave the call, but does not terminate if there are more than 1 caller in the call.
delete.description: Hang up call automation service from the call. This will make call automation service leave the call, but does not terminate if there are more than 1 caller in the call.

204.description: Call automation service has left the call.

parameters.name: Repeatability-Request-ID
parameters.description: If specified, the client directs that the request is repeatable; that is, that the client can make the request multiple times with the same Repeatability-Request-Id and get back an appropriate response without the server executing the request multiple times. post.summary: Transfer the call to a participant.
post.description: Transfer the call to a participant.

parameters.name: Repeatability-Request-ID
parameters.description: If specified, the client directs that the request is repeatable; that is, that the client can make the request multiple times with the same Repeatability-Request-Id and get back an appropriate response without the server executing the request multiple times. The value of the Repeatability-Request-Id is an opaque string representing a client-generated unique identifier for the request. It is a version 4 (random) UUID.

parameters.description: If Repeatability-Request-ID header is specified, then Repeatability-First-Sent header must also be specified. The value should be the date and time at which the request was first created, expressed using the IMF-fixdate form of HTTP-date. Example: Sun, 06 Nov 1994 08:49:37 GMT.

202.description: The service has accepted the transfer request and will begin processing it. You will receive either CallTransferAccepted or CallTransferFailed event at your specified callback URI to update you on the status of the request.

post.summary: Plays audio to participants in the call.
post.description: Plays audio to participants in the call.

202.description: The service has accepted the play request and will begin processing it. You will receive either PlayCompleted or PlayFailed event at your specified callback URI to update you on the status of the request.

post.summary: Cancel all media operations in a call.
post.description: Cancel all media operations in a call.

202.description: The service has accepted the cancel request and will begin processing it. RecognizeCanceled and/or PlayCanceled at your specified callback URI to update you on the status of the request, based on which media operation has been canceled by it.

The service has accepted the recognize request and will begin processing it. You will receive either RecognizeCompleted or RecognizeFailed event at your specified callback URI to update you on the status of the request.

post.summary: Start continuous Dtmf recognition by subscribing to tones.

200.description: The service has accepted the start continuous recognize request and will begin processing it. You will receive events at your specified callback URI to update you on the status of the request.

post.summary: Stop continuous Dtmf recognition by unsubscribing to tones.

200.description: The service has accepted the stop continuous recognize request and will begin processing it. You will receive events at your specified callback URI to update you on the status of the request.

200.description: Returns the start call recording response.

204.description: Returns the stop call recording response.

202.description: The service has accepted the pause request and will begin processing it.
The service has accepted the resume request and will begin processing it.

CreateCallRequest.description: The request payload for creating the call.

sourceCallerIdNumber.description:
The source caller Id, a phone number, that's shown to the PSTN participant being invited.
Required only when calling a PSTN callee.

sourceDisplayName.description: Display name of the call if dialing out to a pstn number

source.description: The identifier of the source of the call

operationContext.description: A customer set value used to track the answering of a call.

cognitiveServicesEndpoint.description: The identifier of the Cognitive Service resource assigned to this call.

CallConnectionStateModel.description: The state of the call connection.

sourceCallerIdNumber.description:
The source caller Id, a phone number, that's shown to the PSTN participant being invited.
Required only when calling a PSTN callee.

sourceDisplayName.description: Display name of the call if dialing out to a pstn number.

correlationId.description: The correlation ID.

answeredBy.description: Identity of the answering entity. Only populated when identity is provided in the request.

AnswerCallRequest.description: The request payload for answering the call.

incomingCallContext.description: The context associated with the call.

operationContext.description: A customer set value used to track the answering of a call.

cognitiveServicesEndpoint.description: The endpoint URL of the Azure Cognitive Services resource attached

answeredBy.description: The identifier of the call automation entity which answers the call

RedirectCallRequest.description: The request payload for redirecting the call.

incomingCallContext.description: The context associated with the call.

target.description: The target identity to redirect the call to.

RejectCallRequest.description: The request payload for rejecting the call.

incomingCallContext.description: The context associated with the call.

TransferToParticipantRequest.description: The request payload for transferring call to a participant.

targetParticipant.description: The identity of the target where call should be transferred to.

operationContext.description: Used by customers when calling mid-call actions to correlate the request to the response event.

TransferCallResponse.description: The response payload for transferring the call.

operationContext.description: The operation context provided by client.

playSources.description: The source of the audio to be played.

playTo.description:
The list of call participants play provided audio to.
Plays to everyone in the call when not provided.

playOptions.description: Defines options for playing the audio.

operationContext.description: The value to identify context of the operation.

PlaySourceType.description: Defines the type of the play source

playSourceCacheId.description: Defines the identifier to be used for caching related media

file.description: Defines the file source info to be used for play

text.description: Defines the text source info to be used for play

ssml.description: Defines the ssml(Speech Synthesis Markup Language) source info to be used for play

loop.description: The option to play the provided audio source in loop when set to true

uri.description: Uri for the audio file to be played

text.description: Text for the cognitive service to be played

sourceLocale.description:
Source language locale to be played
Refer to available locales here: <seealso href="https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/speech-service/language-support?tabs=stt-tts" />

voiceName.description:
Voice name to be played
Refer to available Text-to-speech voices here: <seealso href="https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/speech-service/language-support?tabs=stt-tts" />

customVoiceEndpointId.description: Endpoint where the custom voice was deployed.

ssmlText.description: Ssml string for the cognitive service to be played

customVoiceEndpointId.description: Endpoint where the custom voice was deployed.

RecognizeInputType.description: Determines the type of the recognition.

playPrompt.description: The source of the audio to be played for recognition.

interruptCallMediaOperation.description: If set recognize can barge into other existing queued-up/currently-processing requests.

operationContext.description: The value to identify context of the operation.

interruptPrompt.description: Determines if we interrupt the prompt and start recognizing.

initialSilenceTimeoutInSeconds.description: Time to wait for first input after prompt (if any).

targetParticipant.description: Target participant of DTMF tone recognition.

speechLanguage.description: Speech language to be recognized, If not set default is en-US

speechRecognitionModelEndpointId.description: Endpoint where the custom model was deployed.

interToneTimeoutInSeconds.description: Time to wait between DTMF inputs to stop recognizing.

maxTonesToCollect.description: Maximum number of DTMF tones to be collected.

stopTones.description: List of tones that will stop recognizing.

endSilenceTimeoutInMs.description: The length of end silence when user stops speaking and cogservice send response.

operationContext.description: The value to identify context of the operation.

tones.description: List of tones to be sent to target participant.

targetParticipant.description: Target participant of send Dtmf tones.

operationContext.description: The value to identify context of the operation.
The operation context provided by client.

GetParticipantsResponse.description: The response payload for getting participants of the call.

value.description: List of the current participants in the call.

nextLink.description: Continue of the list of participants

AddParticipantRequest.description: The request payload for adding participant to the call.

sourceCallerIdNumber.description:
The source caller Id, a phone number, that's shown to the PSTN participant being invited.
Required only when inviting a PSTN participant.

sourceDisplayName.description:
(Optional) The display name of the source that is associated with this invite operation when
adding a PSTN participant or teams user.  Note: Will not update the display name in the roster.

invitationTimeoutInSeconds.description:
Gets or sets the timeout to wait for the invited participant to pickup.
The maximum value of this is 180 seconds

operationContext.description: Used by customers when calling mid-call actions to correlate the request to the response event.

AddParticipantResponse.description: The response payload for adding participants to the call.

participant.description: List of current participants in the call.

operationContext.description: The operation context provided by client.

RemoveParticipantRequest.description: The remove participant by identifier request.

participantToRemove.description: The participants to be removed from the call.

operationContext.description: Used by customers when calling mid-call actions to correlate the request to the response event.

RemoveParticipantResponse.description: The response payload for removing participants of the call.

operationContext.description: The operation context provided by client.

MuteParticipantsRequest.description: The request payload for muting participants from the call.

targetParticipants.description:
Participants to be muted from the call.
Only ACS Users are supported.

operationContext.description: Used by customers when calling mid-call actions to correlate the request to the response event.

MuteParticipantsResult.description: The result payload for muting participants from the call.

operationContext.description: The operation context provided by client.

RecordingContentType.description: The content type of call recording.

RecordingChannelType.description: The channel type of call recording.

RecordingFormatType.description: The format type of call recording.

StartCallRecordingRequest.description: The request payload start for call recording operation with call locator.

recordingStateCallbackUri.description: The uri to send notifications to.

audioChannelParticipantOrdering.description:
The sequential order in which audio channels are assigned to participants in the unmixed recording.
When 'recordingChannelType' is set to 'unmixed' and `audioChannelParticipantOrdering is not specified,
the audio channel to participant mapping will be automatically assigned based on the order in which participant
first audio was detected.  Channel to participant mapping details can be found in the metadata of the recording.

channelAffinity.description:
The channel affinity of call recording
When 'recordingChannelType' is set to 'unmixed', if channelAffinity is not specified, 'channel' will be automatically assigned.
Channel-Participant mapping details can be found in the metadata of the recording.
///

CallLocator.description: The locator used for joining or taking action on a call.

channel.description: Channel number to which bitstream from a particular participant will be written.

participant.description:
The identifier for the participant whose bitstream will be written to the channel 
represented by the channel number.

AddParticipantFailed.description: The failed to add participants event.

correlationId.description: Correlation ID for event to call correlation. Also called ChainId for skype chain ID.

operationContext.description: Used by customers when calling mid-call actions to correlate the request to the response event.

resultInformation.description: Contains the resulting SIP code, sub-code and message.

code.description: Code of the current result. This can be helpful to Call Automation team to troubleshoot the issue if this result was unexpected.

subCode.description: Subcode of the current result. This can be helpful to Call Automation team to troubleshoot the issue if this result was unexpected.

message.description: Detail message that describes the current result.

speechResult.description: Defines the result for RecognitionType = Speech and SpeechOrDtmf

label.description: Label is the primary identifier for the choice detected

recognizedPhrase.description:
Phrases are set to the value if choice is selected via phrase detection.
If Dtmf input is recognized, then Label will be the identifier for the choice detected and phrases will be set to null
